Kennedy Jr told HuffPost Live host Josh Zepps in an interview Friday that he believes conservative media outlets such as Fox News are damaging the country. Asked how he thought things have changed in the political landscape, Kennedy pointed to "big money" and "the right wing control of the American media, starting with Fox News" as hurtful to collaboration between differing political interests. item.title: Despite Tax Increase, California State Revenues in Freefall
item.description: Despite Tax Increase, California State Revenues in Freefall http://t.co/e4VueJoX - @biggovt
item.content:encoded: Despite Tax Increase, California State Revenues in Freefall http://t.co/e4VueJoX - @biggovt California State Controller John Chiang has announced that total state revenue for the month of November 2012 fell $806.8 million, or 10.8%, below budget. Despite reassurances from academics and progressive media, the passage of the tax hike known as Proposition 30 may have spurred the state's millionaires to flee, causing this shortfall. item.title: Dear Journalists at Vice and Elsewhere, Here Are Some Simple Ways Not To Get Your Source Arrested - Forbes
item.description: Dear Journalists at Vice and Elsewhere, Here Are Some Simple Ways Not To Get Your Source Arrested http://t.co/LZUXBh3I
item.content:encoded: Dear Journalists at Vice and Elsewhere, Here Are Some Simple Ways Not To Get Your Source Arrested http://t.co/LZUXBh3I Computer security millionaire John McAfee's surreal flight from Belizean law enforcement came to an end this week when he was detained (and then hospitalized) in Guatemala, as has been widely reported. A piece of the story that hasn't been included in much of that reporting is how authorities figured out McAfee -- who was wanted for questioning in the shooting death of his neighbor -- had fled Belize for Guatemala. McAfee's location was exposed after he agreed to let two reporters from Vice Magazine tag along with him. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: forbes.com

item.title: Hey You Big Idiots, Now Can I Use My Phone on Planes?
item.description: Hey You Big Idiots, Now Can I Use My Phone on Planes? http://t.co/xEcqlrX5
item.content:encoded: Hey You Big Idiots, Now Can I Use My Phone on Planes? http://t.co/xEcqlrX5 I've traveled 18,054 miles on airplanes this year. That's 27 flights. And on each of those 27 takeoffs and 27 landings, a hungover flight attendant has asked me and my fellow travelers to turn off our phones. I didn't, not once. And you know what? I didn't die. All 27 planes found the runway, none of their engines sputtered out. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: gizmodo.com

item.title: 73% of Jobs Created in Last Five Months Government Jobs
item.description: 73% of Jobs Created In Last Five Months are Government Jobs http://t.co/vAygbpSz via @BreitbartNews
item.content:encoded: 73% of Jobs Created In Last Five Months are Government Jobs http://t.co/vAygbpSz via @BreitbartNews A deep-dive into the employment numbers also reveals that it's mainly government workers benefitting from what meager job growth we are seeing. Over the last five months, 73% of all jobs created were government jobs. Moreover, the unemployment rate for government workers plunged to 3.8% in November -- which is considered full employment. Link - Trackbacks
